bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. POSEY:H.R. 450.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 1Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3[Page H315]

item.name: Consumer Protection and Financial Institutions Subcommittee

item.title: Responsible Consumer Financial Protection Regulations Act of 2013

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. (text of measure as introduced in Senate: CR S6079-6080)

item.title: Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection Accountability Act of 2013

latestAction.text: Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on Financial Institutions and Consumer Credit Prior to Referral.

item.name: Consumer Protection and Financial Institutions Subcommittee

item.text: Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on Financial Institutions and Consumer Credit Prior to Referral.
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection Accountability Act - Amends the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to subject the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) to regular appropriations.

Repeals the requirement of an annual transfer to the CFPB of funds from the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System. Subjects the CFPB to the regular authorization, budget, and appropriations process of the Department of the Treasury.

Repeals establishment of the CFPB Fund.

Replaces the authorization of appropriations for FY2010-FY2014 with an authorization for FY2013 only.

bill.title: Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection Accountability Act

item.title: Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection Accountability Act
Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection Accountability Act
To amend the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to bring the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection into the regular appropriations process, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on Financial Institutions and Consumer Credit Prior to Referral.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
